intro: Chaptalia hololeuca, commonly known as the whiteleaf chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and other aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, silvery-green leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Chaptalia hololeuca is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
